Thread#

Here, the class Thread are shown and described.

namespace mml
namespace thread#

Functions

void sleep(float s) noexcept#

Stop actual thread for a specific time.

Parameters:

s – Seconds to wait

template<typename result>
class Threads#
#include <thread.hpp>

Class Threads.

This class provides functions which can be used to start a task with multiple threads

Public Functions

inline Threads(int num)#

Initialize with a number of threads.

Parameters:

num – Number of Threads

inline Threads &operator=(const Threads &thread) noexcept#

Operator =.

Parameters:

thread – to be copied

Returns:

Instance of this class

inline ~Threads()#
inline void start(const std::function<result(int)> &task, int id)#

Starts a function with a specific thread.

Note

The first argument of the function must be the threadID

Note

If task has parameters besides the thread id, one needs to create a lambda function: auto task = [arg1, arg2](int threadId) -> [return type of the function] {return exampleTask(threadId, arg1, arg2);};

Parameters:

  • task – Function to be executed

  • id – Thread id which should execute this function

Throws:

runtime_error – : if id > number of threads

inline void start(const std::function<result(int)> &task) noexcept#

Put a specific thread to sleep.

Starts a function for all threads

Note

The first argument of the function must be the threadId

Note

If task has parameters besides the thread id, one needs to create a lambda function: auto task = [arg1, arg2](int threadId) -> [return type of the function] {return exampleTask(threadId, arg1, arg2);};

Parameters:

task – Function to be executed

inline void sleep(int threadId, int id, double seconds)#

Puts a specific thread to sleep. This is should be used inside a lambda function when the function start is started!

Parameters:

  • threadId – The threadId of the thread

  • id – Thread id to sleep

  • seconds – Duration in seconds to sleep

Throws:

runtime_error – : if id is bigger than the size

inline std::vector<result> getResults() noexcept#

Get the results from each thread.

Returns:

Vector with the results of each thread

inline void join() noexcept#

Joins all threads and waits for unfinished threads.

Public Members

int size = 0#

Number of Threads.

Private Members

std::vector<std::thread> threads#
std::vector<std::future<result>> futures#
std::mutex mtx#

Friends

template<typename templ>
inline friend Threads &operator<<(Threads &threads, const templ &value) noexcept#

Output a text while taking into account if another thread is writing.

Parameters:

  • threads – Instance of the class used to print

  • value – to be printed

Returns:

ostream

inline friend Threads &operator<<(Threads &threads, std::ostream &(*manip)(std::ostream&)) noexcept#

Output special characters like std::endl.

Parameters:

  • threads – Instance of the class used to print

  • manip – to be printed

Returns:

ostream
